meanings.definition: To make something appear out of focus.
meanings.sent1: When I defocus my eyes, everything becomes blurry.
meanings.sent2: Photographers often defocus the background to make the subject stand out.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally defocus my camera and now all the pictures are blurry!
meanings.sent4: Her tears made it hard to see clearly, as if the world had defocused around her.
meanings.sent5: The fog was so thick that it seemed to defocus everything in sight.

meanings.definition: To shift the focus away from something.
meanings.sent1: Let's defocus from the problem and look at the bigger picture.
meanings.sent2: During the meeting, the speaker defocused from the main topic and started talking about unrelated issues.
meanings.sent3: Trying to defocus from the delicious cake in front of me was a real challenge.
meanings.sent4: Her bright smile had the power to defocus attention from any negative thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The sudden noise made me defocus from my book and look around.

meanings.definition: The act of intentionally blurring an image.
meanings.sent1: The defocus in the painting gave it a dreamy quality.
meanings.sent2: In photography, defocus can be used creatively to evoke emotions.
meanings.sent3: The artist's use of defocus in the background added depth to the portrait.
meanings.sent4: The defocus in the movie scene created a sense of mystery and intrigue.
meanings.sent5: The deliberate defocus of the landscape painting made it look like a beautiful blur.
